The ability to hit an enemy
The ability to block an enemy\'s attack
Are you sure you want\nto leave this quest ?
Welcome to this tutorial !\n\nWWII is a heavy tactical real-time strategy game. We\'ll see here how to lead your troops to victory.

How to win ?

There are 2 ways to win a game in WWII : either you destroy the whole army of your opponent or you can win by conquering all the Strategic Points of the map.
These are randomly placed in players' deployment zones when the battle starts.
Navigate through the map\n\n You can navigate through the map by sweeping the screen with one finger; you can zoom in/ zoom out by pinching the screen.

Command your units

You can give 4 different orders to your units :
Move, Fire, Ambush and Defend orders.

Move orders

Touch and Drag a unit to another location on the battlefield to give a Move Order.
While dragging the unit, you'll see a Shield icon appearing if the Move Order destination gives any sort of protection.

Fire orders

If you target an enemy unit while giving an order to a unit, the order line will go from green to red, if the unit can shoot on the target, or black if there is no line of sight to reach the target.
The distance label color will also be updated based on the chance to hit the target :
Black = no chance, Green = best chances.

Defend / Ambush orders

When the battle starts all your soldiers are given Ambush orders and your vehicles Defend orders. 
To give a Ambush order, just tap on a unit previously selected. If you tap on it again it will switch to a Defend order.
While having Ambush orders, your units will be harder to localize, and will stay ambush until enemy units are close enough. With a Defend order, a unit will shoot at any enemy unit it sees.

Units information

Let's now have a look at a selected unit information layout !
First line contains the name (the color displays the health of the unit, from green = healthy, to red = dead), the experience (no medal = recruit, 1 medal = veteran, 2 medals = elite) and the hauts-faits counter.
Then, you have the weapons with their anti-personal and anti-tank efficiencies and the amount of ammo left.
Last line contains the current action of the unit.

Units behaviours\n\nIn WWII, the units are behaving like real human beings. Units under fire will hide themselves and will sometimes not be able to react. Less-experienced units will panic more than experienced ones. Before shooting, a unit will have to aim, and reload its weapon if needed. Units will adjust their firing speed depending on the amount of ammo left.

Vehicles and tanks\n\nVehicles and tanks are powerful but expensive and less maneuverable units. Keep in mind that sides and rear of vehicles are more vulnerable. On short distance, vehicles can reverse. Watch out your troops, vehicles can run over soldiers. Vehicles can fire with their secondary weapon while moving.

Terrains

Using the terrain covers is one of the keys to success.
Bushes do not block line of sights but provide light protections.
Trees, fields and houses block line of sights and are giving medium to high covers to your soldiers.

Well done !

This tutorial is now finished.
Try to seek and destroy the 2 enemy riflemen on the map.
Good luck !
